data.title: The View....
data.text: Very Beautiful Building especially as the sun rose in the morning. The setting was made better by the changing of the colors on the trees...

data.title: Beautiful building
data.text: Too bad I am still paying for it!  Wow they spared no expense it seems in building this palace!  There are a few exhibits that are very interesting and maybe you'll get to see the government at work or people yelling at them outside.

data.title: One of the Grandest
data.text: This was one of the most beautiful capitols, and the tour was excellent.  There is free parking at the legistlative building where the tours start.

data.title: Excellent tour guides
data.text: Her Bucket List is to see all the state Capitol Buildings and take the tours. This is one of the better ones we have been on because the tour guide was personable, knowledgeable, and cared for the people on the tour to make sure they had the best experience possible. The building itself is easy to find, easy to park at, and a delight to the eyes as you are taken through the building. Don't forget to sit in the Wishing Chair as the is, in our opinion, the highlight of the tour. This is definitely a must see thing on your travels in Connecticut.

data.title: Best guided tour I have ever had.
data.text: Very nice kept building. So much great history. The architecture is stunning. I would highly recommend the guided tour. It lasts about 45 minutes and the guides are wonderfully knowledgeable.

data.title: Great tour wonderful staff
data.text:
This is a beautiful building and all of the staff we encountered were wonderful  representives for Connecticut.  Brian Skehan was especially kind and helpful even recommending a place for lunch.
We had a very nice guided tour. We have visited over 40 state capitol buildings and thus was one of my favorites.  
A friendly welcoming staff made our visit that much better.

data.title: Picturesque State Capitol
data.text: Picturesque State Capitol. Not much to see and do in downtown Hartford but the state capitol is a really cool building that is surrounded by a park. Worth a visit or drive by

data.title: Magnificent Building
data.text: Grand and stately building , this was our first tour of a state Capitol .  The free 1 hour (plus) tour was informative and most impressive.  As we were ending the tour , Gov Malloy stepped out to greet us !  Nice way to end a perfect tour .

data.title: Capital Walk Around
data.text:
We spent the afternoon strolling the halls of the capital. A lot of history  "is heard" with every step you take. The exterior of the capital is beautiful. Even more beautiful, the inside. I won't spoil it for you. Take the time to take in every floor, every chamber. They have respectfully honored their fallen heroes from every war....Take the time, you won't be sorry.

PS Be sure to check out the arch at the bottom of the entrance to the capital grounds.

data.title: beautiful building
data.text: Very royal looking with unique architecture and very big inside. Nice for a day trip if in the Hartford area

data.title: Free public tours
data.text: We went on the off chance that we would be allowed in and were delighted when we discovered that there were free tours for the public which covered the newer legislative building as well as the state Capitol. We had a very knowledgeable guide who explained the history and significance of the building and its contents. It is beautiful inside. We were able to go into the House of Representatives and the senate. The tour lasts about an hour.

data.title: Our 13th. State Capitol
data.text: The day we visited the Capitol we were quite fortunate to have an outstanding tour guide  and a couple who worked for the National Park Service join us.  Between the couple and guide we were given both a history lesson about  Connecticut from the revolution to current day but we were exposed to many historical facts about the Civil War.  The Building was awesome.

data.title: Fantastic capitol building tour!
data.text: Took kids (6, 9, and 12 years) to the state capitol for a tour.  It was an amazingly beautiful building and the tour lets you sit in the Charter Oak chair (for the Lieutenant Governor) and all sorts of behind the scene peeks.  Saw the actual governor going up the stairs to his office!  Kids loved it and I loved the history part!

data.title: Impressive
data.text: We were only in Hartford briefly on a Sunday and stopped by the State Capitol - it was deserted, we were the only ones walking about and looking at it so were able to get some good pictures.  Lovely building

data.title: Pretty
data.text: Visiting in summer but we were pleasantly surprised at how well the gardens are landscaped and maintain.  Such a hot, humid day but walking through the gardens was so peaceful and serene. Oh and the building was pretty impressive too!

data.title: Magnificent Building
data.text: Visited with my wife during a 6,000 mile road trip from and to Chicago. We have visited most of the State Capitol buildings in America as we are about to complete our visits to all 50 States on this tour. This is a magnificent building and visually one of the best. Inside it is similar to all the others which all seem to follow a set blue print.

data.title: Glad we stopped!
data.text: The architecture of this building is magnificent! We saw a picture of the building in our Ct. travel book and were so captured by the book's picture, we had to see it in person...it leaves you speechless. As we were walking up to the building, Connecticut's Lieutenant Governor, Nancy Wyman, made it a point to stop and introduce herself and shake our 5 year old son's hand. What a great start to what would be a perfect visit. We took a guided tour and were given a presentation by State Representative Sam Belsito in the House of Representatives. All of the staff (lady in the gift shop, Capitol Police) were very pleasant and helpful. There is so much history here. We were happy to be a part of it for awhile.

data.title: State Capitol stop
data.text:
Wife and I visited here the other night with our pet corgi to visit the Capitol so we can get to all 50.  
Building was very large and impressive. Can see it for several miles.  The grounds were very well taken care of.  Pet waste stations around the property.  
Connecticut residents can take pride in their capitol.

data.title: CT residents, you can be proud!
data.text: What a beautiful building and the connecting Legislative Building where the tours begin is magnificent. Our tour guide, Paul, was very knowledgeable and very accommodating of our Senior group. He took time to answer questions while giving us the ability to see both chambers, who were not in session, but beautiful! The marble, stained glass and hand painted walls were amazing. As a previous resident and now living in GA, we had never been to the Capitol, this was an opportunity we could pass up!

data.title: A wonderful old building
data.text: If you like fine old places, there's marble everywhere.  I go to a meeting there so have not had a tour, but do look forward to it each time.  Wonderful building.
